alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 2:17AM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Phillips. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 215 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Loring, Port Of Morgan and Chapman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
